subject: -Djava.ext.dirs issue?

Subject: -Djava.ext.dirs issue?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=421974874; y=ITyoVR-k0-vxXxxzeAIqft9xcehvITmjKu7Jigt_pvFz7CE

Hi,

I have a problem where if I specify the java "ext" directory, JUnit is=
 unable to find my test class.  Whereas, if I just use "classpath", everyth=
ing is fine.  Since my tests will ultimately depend on a number of 3rd part=
y libraries, I really want to just use the "ext" directory approach.

For e=
xample:

java -classpath /home/cowan/src/atst/lib/java/classes -Djava.ext.d=
irs=3D/home/cowan/src/atst/lib/java/ext org.junit.runner.JUnitCore atst.cs.=
test.TestAll  

this ends up with 
   JUnit version 4.7
   Could not find c=
lass: atst.cs.test.TestAll

The strange thing is that if I use the verbose =
flag on java, it even logs that it successfully loaded the TestAll class fr=
om the appropriate directory before later displaying the error.

If I modif=
y the command line to:

java -classpath /home/cowan/src/atst/lib/java/class=
es:/home/cowan/tools/junit4.7/junit.jar  org.junit.runner.JUnitCore atst.cs=
.test.TestAll

everything works as expected.

Does anyone know why -Djava.e=
xt.dirs seems to cause JUnit to malfunction?  (I've only tried this with JU=
nit 4.7)

Thanks,
  Bruce
